<title level="1" right="Focus 4" pfs="Standard">
[Transcribe Moment](/Spells.aspx?ID=831)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 45

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You instantly create a small, permanent scroll that contains a magically precise written description of your current surroundings in every direction. Any creature who spends 1 minute to read the scroll—written in a language of your choice that you know— immediately sees and experiences your surroundings during the moment that you recorded (including whatever events transpired that round) exactly as you experienced it. This depiction records only what you can sense yourself. For example, if you can't see [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26) creatures, the depiction doesn't reveal them even to a reader who could normally see them; a reader can't use their Perception to notice details you missed, but they can attempt a check to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) based on what they just experienced if they have knowledge that you lack. You can have multiple scrolls from _transcribe moment_ in existence at the same time, up to a number equal to your Intelligence modifier. If you Cast the Spell again while already at the maximum number of scrolls, choose one of the current scrolls to lose its magic, then create the new one.
name: Transcribe Moment
